column5: Hey guys, I need some ideas on what to get my father for Christmas. He is 70 years old and goes fishing at some fly - in lakes up near Timmins, ON a few times a year. I know weight is an issue so last year I bought him a light weight sleeping bag. This year, I have no idea what to get him. He has all the right bait and tackle so I ask you pro's on what to get him. I was thinking polarized sunglasses, but I'm up for suggestions. Thanks for the help!
Fenix PD30 LED flashlight, including strobe.

A Nice pair of Costa Del Mar Sunglasses with built in readers would be an awesome gift. I know I got a pair as a gift. Lifetime warranty for any type of damage. Awesome clarity-readers in just the right spot. They are pricey but worth it to me anyways.

A high quality headlamp would be a perfect gift. REI has a nice selection. I have worn mine on fly-ins and camping; everyone wants to borrow. After each trip, the same people immediatley go shopping. Keep in mind that you get what you pay for.
How about a diamond flake hook sharpener. The ones with the pocket clip are especially nice, and very useful. Bill Krejca
some of the very light, high quality raingear would make an excellent gift for any flyin guy phish
Wow thanks for the replies! I bought him a nice led headlamp for his birthday. He loves it.Phish, you have my attention. What kind of light rain gear are thinking?
How about zip-off pants? Eliminates the need to take both shorts and long pants. Two pair, you're good to go for a whole week.
cabelas pac-lite rainy river is the best - it's a bit expensive but to me this is one item that you can't spend too much on. phish

Phish is on the right track. I went to Canada for a couple years thinking I could get by with a "cheaper" rainsuit. After a week of rain/wind and cold...I came home and spent the $$$$. Cabela's Guidewear bibs and Coat, you simply cannot go wrong. Now that suit is the first thing packed. It is the only coat I pack and the bibs are comfortable all day. If it gets too warm they stuff into my dry bag.If you want to be the "son of the year" get him a GOOD rain suit!
